intro: Lampranthus disgregus, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The plant's fleshy leaves and ability to store water make it well adapted to arid environments.
